description: Ground truth rankings for 2026-01-01 papers based on user profile: CV/few-shot, small LLMs (12GB VRAM constraint), multimodal, agentic. Focus on efficiency and 'solutions architect' + 'researcher' goals.

rankings.title: Youtu-LLM: Unlocking the Native Agentic Potential for Lightweight Large Language Models
rankings.key_match: Perfect fit: Small LLM (1.96B fits 12GB), Agentic, Training from scratch (research interest).
rankings.reasoning: Directly addresses the user's compute constraint (12GB VRAM) while targeting their key learning goal (Agentic LLMs). The 'from scratch' training provides the deep research insight they want.

rankings.title: Let It Flow: Agentic Crafting on Rock and Roll, Building the ROME Model
rankings.reasoning: Strong match for 'Agentic LLM Development' learning goal. The 'open agentic learning ecosystem' is practical for a solutions architect.

rankings.title: JavisGPT: A Unified Multi-modal LLM for Sounding-Video Comprehension
rankings.reasoning: Hits the 'Multimodal applications' and 'fine tune models across modalities' goals perfectly. Unified architecture is a key interest.

rankings.title: Factorized Learning for Temporally Grounded Video-Language Models
rankings.reasoning: Specific CV+LLM intersection problem (temporal grounding). Highly relevant to 'Multimodal applications' specialization.

rankings.title: Figure It Out: Improving Reasoning with Active Visual Thinking
rankings.reasoning: Integrates 'visual thinking' into reasoning, bridging the user's strong CV background with their interest in LLM reasoning.

rankings.title: Forging Spatial Intelligence: Multi-Modal Data Pre-Training
rankings.reasoning: Strong technical match for 'multimodal' and 'pre-training'. Slightly more autonomous-systems focused, but 'Spatial Intelligence' is very relevant.

rankings.title: AI Meets Brain: Memory Systems for Autonomous Agents
rankings.reasoning: Good conceptual overview for the 'Agentic LLM Development' learning goal, though less code-focused than others.

rankings.title: Pretraining Frame Preservation in Video Memory Compression
rankings.reasoning: Addresses 'compute-limited' constraint (compression) applied to Video (CV background). Practical for efficient multimodal systems.

rankings.title: mHC: Manifold-Constrained Hyper-Connections
rankings.reasoning: General architectural improvement (ResNet evolution). Important for a researcher/architect to know, even if not strictly Multimodal/Agentic.

rankings.title: Fantastic Reasoning Behaviors: Unsupervised Discovery of Reasoning
rankings.reasoning: Deep dive into LLM internals. Good for the 'Researcher' persona, but less connected to CV/Multimodal specific goals.

rankings.title: PhyGDPO: Physics-Aware Text-to-Video Generation
rankings.reasoning: Video generation is relevant to CV. 'Physics-aware' is a specific niche. Good fit, but maybe lower priority than core multimodal LLMs.

rankings.title: GR-Dexter Technical Report
rankings.reasoning: Vision-Language-Action is relevant, but the 'dexterous hand' robotics focus might be too hardware-specific for the user's general multimodal profile.

rankings.title: Guiding a Diffusion Transformer with Internal Dynamics
rankings.reasoning: Solid CV/Generative paper. 'Diffusion Transformer' is a key technology, but less 'LLM' focused than top picks.

rankings.title: BEDA: Belief Estimation for Strategic Dialogue Acts
rankings.reasoning: Focuses on dialogue/belief. Relevant to Agents, but less 'multimodal' or 'efficient' than others.

rankings.title: SpaceTimePilot: Generative Rendering of Dynamic Scenes
rankings.reasoning: CV/Rendering focus. Good for background, but the user is moving *toward* LLMs, so pure CV/Rendering is lower priority.

rankings.title: Scaling Open-Ended Reasoning to Predict the Future
rankings.reasoning: Forecasting focus. Interesting LLM application, but distinct from the user's Multimodal/CV core.

rankings.title: GaMO: Geometry-aware Multi-view Diffusion for 3D Reconstruction
rankings.reasoning: Pure CV/3D task. User has this background but wants to move to LLMs. Low novelty/relevance for current *growth* goals.

rankings.title: Valori: A Deterministic Memory Substrate for AI Systems
rankings.reasoning: Low-level systems/memory paper. 'Deterministic memory' is niche. Less relevant to application/model architecture.

rankings.title: Anomaly Detection in Operating System Logs
rankings.reasoning: Different domain (Security/SysAdmin). 'Multimodal' here is logs, not CV.

rankings.title: Respiratory Sound Classification with Transformers
rankings.reasoning: Niche medical application. Little transfer to general multimodal/agentic goals.
